PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis module¶

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.compare_to_blanc(blanc_model_size, zoom_range_selector, real_knowledge_interface=None, p_val=0.05)[source]¶

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.decide_regeneration()[source]¶

A script to decide at what point it is better to recompute a new a network rather then go through the time it requires to be upickled. The current decision is that for the samples of the size of ~ 100 Uniprots, we are better off unpickling from 4 and more by factor 2 and by factor 10 from 9 Previous experimets have shown that memoization with pickling incurred no noticeable delay on samples of up to 50 UPs, but that the storage limit on mongo DB was rapidly exceeded, leading us to create an allocated dump file.

  • sample_sizes – times each sample size is sampled

PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.select(tri_array, array_column, selection_span)[source]¶

Convinient small function to select a from tri_array all the elements where the column number array_column is within the selection span

Parameters:
  • tri_array – the matrix on which we will be performing the selection
  • array_column – column on which the selection span will be applied
  • selection_span – span for which we are going to keep the column.
Returns:
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.show_corrs(tri_corr_array, meancorrs, eigvals, selector, test_tri_corr_array, test_meancorr, eigval, resamples)[source]¶

A general function that performs demonstration of an example of random samples of the same size as our sample and of our sample and conducts the statistical tests on wherther any of nodes or functional groups in our sample are non-random

Parameters:
  • tri_corr_array – [[current, informativity, confusion_potential], ...] - characteristics of the random samples
  • meancorrs – [[cluster size, average internode connection], ...] - characteristics of clustering random samples with the same parameters
  • eigvals – eigenvalues associated to the interconnection matrix of random samples
  • selector – range on which we would like to visually zoom and plot a histogram
  • test_tri_corr_array – [[current, informativity, confusion_potential], ...] - characteristics of the true sample. If none, nothing happens
  • test_meancorr – [[cluster size, average internode connection], ...] - characteristics of clustering the true sample
  • eigval – eigenvalues associated to the interconnection matrix of the true sample
  • resamples – how many random samples we analyzed for the default model
Returns:
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.spawn_sampler(sample_size_list_plus_iteration_list)[source]¶

Spawns a sampler initalized from the default GO_Interface

Parameters:sample_size_list_plus_iteration_list – combined list of sample swizes and iterations (requried for Pool.map usage)
PolyPharma.neo4j_analyzer.knowledge_access_analysis.spawn_sampler_pool(pool_size, sample_size_list, interation_list_per_pool)[source]¶

Spawns a pool of samplers of the information flow within the GO system

Parameters:
  • pool_size – number of processes that are performing the sample pooling and analyzing
  • sample_size_list – size of the sample list
  • interation_list_per_pool – number of iterations performing the pooling of the samples in each list
